SEARCH
Package com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.utils.validation

Class CardValidator

java.lang.Object
com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.utils.validation.CardValidator
@Component public class CardValidator extends Object
Validates the fields of a Card object to ensure data integrity before processing or persistence.

This class is responsible for field-level validation including:

  • Card number format and range
  • String validation for names and games
  • Rarity enum validation
  • Purchase price formatting and limits
  • Date boundaries and consistency between dates
  • Boolean parsing for "foiled" status

Used as a shared component for input validation across services and utilities.

  • Constructor Details

    • CardValidator

      public CardValidator()
      Default constructor for CardValidator.

      Since this class is managed by Spring as a @Component, explicit construction is typically handled by the Spring container. This constructor exists for clarity and potential future extension.

  • Method Details

    • validateCard

      public ValidatorResult validateCard(Card card)
      Validates all fields of a Card object including ID, name, game, rarity, price, and dates. Aggregates all validation errors and returns a failure if any exist.
      Parameters:
      card - the card object to validate
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating success or listing error messages

    • validateCardNumber

      public ValidatorResult validateCardNumber(String cardNumberString)
      Validates the card number to ensure it is a positive integer and within a 6-digit range.
      Parameters:
      cardNumberString - the card number as a string
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the card number is valid

    • stringValidator

      public ValidatorResult stringValidator(String string)
      Validates that a name or game string is non-empty and contains only letters and spaces.
      Parameters:
      string - the input string to validate
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the string is valid

    • validateCardRarity

      public ValidatorResult validateCardRarity(String rarity)
      Validates that the rarity string corresponds to a valid CardRarity enum constant.
      Parameters:
      rarity - the input rarity string
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the rarity is valid

    • dateValidator

      public ValidatorResult dateValidator(String dateString, DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter)
      Validates that a date string can be parsed and falls within a reasonable range (1900 to 5 years in the future).
      Parameters:
      dateString - the date string to validate
      dateTimeFormatter - the formatter to use for parsing the date
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the date is valid

    • validatePurchasePrice

      public ValidatorResult validatePurchasePrice(String purchasePriceString)
      Validates the purchase price format and range. Ensures it is numeric, non-negative, no more than two decimal places, and below 1,000,000.
      Parameters:
      purchasePriceString - the price as a string
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the price is valid

    • validateIsFoiled

      public ValidatorResult validateIsFoiled(String isFoiledString)
      Validates whether the input string can be interpreted as a boolean ('true' or 'false').
      Parameters:
      isFoiledString - the string representation of a boolean value
      Returns:
      a ValidatorResult indicating if the value is valid
